awd_titl_txt: International Astronomical Union Symposium No. 134 on       "Active Galactic Nuclei"
awd_abstract_narration: The Lick Observatory of the University of California, Santa Cruz                will host the International Astronomical Union (IAU) Symposium No.              134 on "Active Galactic Nuclei" from August 15 to August 19, 1988.              The Symposium will take place on the Santa Cruz campus of the                   University of California and will involve approximately 200                     participants from institutions all over the world. The Symposium                will provide an opportunity to bring together Active Galactic                   Nuclei (AGN) research workers from all over the world to exchange               ideas and results on this very important topic.  active Galactic                Nuclei are quasars, Seyfert galaxies, and other extragalactic                   objects with highly energetic nuclei.  Support will be provided                 for travel and living expenses of some of the participants.  IAU                and the University of California, Santa Cruz are also providing                 financial support.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
